name: (6beta)-6,12-dihydroxyabieta-8,12-diene-11,14-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-816

name: (6beta)-6,12-dihydroxyabieta-8,12-diene-11,14-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-816
Reason: The target compound has a complex structure with significant steric hindrance and multiple functional groups that contribute to a high melting point. Estimated contributions are based on the understanding of intermolecular forces, specifically hydrogen bonding and van der Waals interactions. Knowing the melting point of a similar size hydrocarbon (n-octadecane) provides a base value. The difference between the initial prediction and the actual value prompted a re-evaluation of the effects of functional group contributions, especially accounting for the possibility of intramolecular interactions that do not increase the melting point as much as their intermolecular counterparts.
Prediction:
188°C as the melting point,
which is close to the actual value of 188.0°C.
